docs.lead_paragraph: Two members of President Obama's bipartisan debt-reduction commission -- one a Congressional Republican leader and the other a prominent Democratic economist -- proposed on Wednesday to turn Medicare into a voucher program in 2021, raise its retirement age and give states block grants to take over Medicaid.
docs.abstract: Two members of debt-reduction commission also propose gradually raising the age of Medicare eligibility from 65 to 67.
docs.snippet: Two members of debt-reduction commission also propose gradually raising the age of Medicare eligibility from 65 to 67.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal advisory committee said Wednesday that there was adequate evidence that the drug Provenge prolongs the lives of men with advanced prostate cancer, an endorsement that makes it more likely that Medicare will pay for the $93,000 treatment.
docs.abstract: An advisory committee basically endorses coverage for Provenge, a treatment that costs about $93,000 a patient.
docs.snippet: An advisory committee basically endorses coverage for Provenge, a treatment that costs about $93,000 a patient.

docs.lead_paragraph: 9:55 a.m. | Updated The U.S. Chamber of Commerce appears ready to hit the reset button on its stormy relationship with the White House even as its leaders vow to begin a new battle against what they call excessive regulation by the Obama administration.

headline.main: Chamber Softens Rhetoric but Will Fight Obama Regulations

docs.abstract: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce appears ready to hit the reset button on its stormy relationship with the White House but continues to oppose what it calls excessive regulation.
